messages: a69c381f8abeee9190f77da3759bffa4 (18:53): I run qt3to4, but now I get from kdevelop: #include <Q3VBoxLayout>...Q3VBoxLayout: file not found
a69c381f8abeee9190f77da3759bffa4 (18:53): The file exists in /usr/include/qt4/Qt3Support/Q3VBoxLayout
9ecd0c6620149bd9ec69488edbacb270 (18:54): add CONFIG += qt3support to your .pro file
9ecd0c6620149bd9ec69488edbacb270 (18:54): err QT += qt3support
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:55): And CONFIG += qt
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:56): To enable the QT += line
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:56): (Or is that not necessary anymore? It was necessary in 4.0)
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:56): I don't remember ever having to do CONFIG += qt...
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:56): so I'd guess it isn't necessary anymore
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:57): OK
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:59): although, if I do message($$CONFIG) in the project file, "qt" is already set
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (18:59): Ah, okay, it's default now.
a69c381f8abeee9190f77da3759bffa4 (19:04): _JP: I figured out that using qt3to4 with the .pro file (instead of only .h and .cpp) did exactly that job.
9ecd0c6620149bd9ec69488edbacb270 (19:08): ok, nice to know

0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:18): ahigerd: i got a problem with a qtreewidget... i set acceptdrops() to true and dragging from this widget to itself, it works fine. but once i try to drop something from another widget, it always refuses and blocks
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:18): not even the dragenterevent() and stuff is called
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:21): Blocks? *blink* That's odd.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:22): Can you reproduce it with another widget besides QTreeView?
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:22): hm, didn't try yet, since i really need a qtreewidget
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:22): I'm just wondering how far up the class tree I need to look in the source. :P
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:31): ahigerd: doesn't work with a qlistwidget either
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:31): How about a blank QWidget?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:33): And when you say it blocks, do you mean the app stops responding, or it just doesn't accept the drop?
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:33): now, just the "stop-sign" appears
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:33): and none of the drag/drop event methods is called
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:33): "stop-sign"?
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:33): yeah, you know the "you're not allowed to drop items here" icon
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:33): Oh.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:35): Hmm...

cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:36): So I'm assuming you've reimplemented dragEnterEvent and dropEvent and you've called setAcceptDrops(true), and dragEnterEvent returns the appropriate information to accept the drop?
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:36): just that none of those events ever gets fired off
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:37): Interesting.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:37): Can you make a minimal example? I'll test it on my machine.
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:37): only, when i'm dragging from the same widget
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:37): then it suddenly works as expected
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:37): all methods get called
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:37): How are you starting the drag?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:37): Pastebin if you would
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:38): That was quick.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:38): What event is this?
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:38): sorry, missed the header
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:39): it's basically how the qt-docs suggest it
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:39): the drag start works fine as well
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:39): it's like this qtreewidget only allows drags from itself
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:39): and would ignore everything else automatically
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (19:39): if i use this same startDrag() and drop it on a qtextedit (e.g.) it works fine and pastes
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:40): What's m_parent?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:40): Why are you storing a pointer instead of using parentWidget()? ^^()
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:41): And why are you using the widget's parent instead of the widget itself?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:44): Have you tried varying the parameter to drag->start? (Some or'ed combination of Qt::DropActions)
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:44): anchorAt()...? Are you dragging from a QTextBrowser or something?
0757e9514116664d24667a9b6515b095 (20:01): it's a qtextedit, actually
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (20:01): Same thing, superclass
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (20:03): QTextBrowser is the same thing as QTextEdit; QTextEdit's a superclass
